heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 20 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (181°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 50.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.7 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 566 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 200.5m higher than yesterday, 249.7m lower than the past week, 566.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 642m minimum and 993m maximum, with an average of 955.4m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1205.1m and 1521.7m.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (90%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
